intro: Manettia ignita var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth manettia, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically fragrant. Its fruit is a small, capsule-like structure containing several seeds. The smooth, glabrous (hairless) surface of its stems and leaves is a distinguishing feature of this variety.
